intro: Conyza melastomoides, commonly known as the narrowleaf horseweed, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and roadsides. It produces small, white to yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Conyza melastomoides is an annual herb that can spread through wind-dispersed seeds, making it a common weed in agricultural areas.
